ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: VISHWA JEEVAN SEVA SANGHA (VJSS) is proud to be a contributor to Indias development, particularly in backward areas in Orissa. Our activities have been aimed to uplift the quality of lives from darkness of those people of orissa, especially for those deprived people who belong to scheduled caste and scheduled tribes, living below the poverty line. Our tasks have been finding out the neediest people, giving emphasis to the vulnerable mothers & their children for the prupose to act in accordance with their need and to build up their capacity by clubbing their activities with the integrated process of comprehensive social development. Our approach to development is a bottom-up approach, where the community people get scope to participate in the decision making process. VJSS has always given emphasis to initiate need based programme by the optimum utilization of local resources. Our activities have been multifarious, comprised of raising social awareness on different issues, which have been affecting the human life, covering the community health and child education with appropriate social action as well as livelihood assistance to the disadvantaged and vulnerable people. We have our interventions on many other areas like womens development programmes along with gender issues, training programme of development workers, environment protection and social forestry, drug de-addiction,HIV/AIDS prevention programmes, supporting the disabled and helpless aged etc. VJSS has been successful in establishing good relationship with rural people to interact, share information and mobilize available resources for the poor and marginalized people in our operational area in Orissa, which we consider as the most important achivement of our organisation.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: VISWAS a non-profit making voluntary organisation registered under Societies Registration Act 1860 in the year 2003. A group of dedicated youths united together and have initiated the organisation to work for the people in the locality. In the initial years the Society was engaged in promotion of social and cultural activities in the villages. Gradually the society has realized the socio-economic condition of the people in the villages and started development activities. Importance is always been given on cooperation and participation of the people in implementing the activities. VISWAS has emphasized its work to improve the quality of living of economic backward, poor people, women, youth, children, farmers etc. VISWAS believes in working in collaboration with the Community. During the process of work the Society has established credibility with the people and district administration and other local bodies.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Voluntary Action for the Rural Reconstruction (VARR), a not for profit voluntary organisation registered in 1993 under the Societies Registration Act of 1860 and under FCRA Act. During the last Fifteen years the organization received public and office support and cooperation to materialize its dream of making the rural community self sustaining and progressive. Its innovation in organization building to facilitate participatory intervention proved successful and recognized by different offices and dignitaries. VARR has proved to be a promoter of Organisations of the target groups. 185 Women Self Help Groups involving 2100 women individual members (SHGs) have been formed and strengthened to empower the rural poor women mass. VARR organized different skill development and entrepreneurship training programmes in partnership with NABARD, CAPART and Government of Orissa and introduced micro finance activities. Community participation in Joint Forest Management and environment conservation emphasized by VARR got the recognition from district and state offices. In health sector, VARR actively participated in different programmes sponsored by the Govt. of India and collaborated with the district health department to make the events successful. Starting from immunization programmes to malaria prevention activities, VARR with partnership with NRHM, Orissa provided two nos of vehicle for Zanani Express to carry the pregnant women for safe institutional delivery at the hospitals and to carry the neonates for necessary treatment and provided thematic training to ASHAs. Technology transfer in collaboration with Krishi Vigyana Kendra and OUAT, Bhubaneswar is a regular activity and to this effect a number of training cum demonstration programmes has been organized.Major Achievements Provided Entrepreneurship Training to 420 nos Rural Women Transportation facilities for Institutional delivery provided to 1500 nos of pregnant women through Janai Express Distributed 7010 impregnated Mosquitonet Provided Irrigation facilities to 500 acres of land Facilitated 185 Self Help Groups 250 youth have been trained in different trade like Bamboo craft, tailoring, Dhocracasting Pressed leaf cup and plate making Training provided to 723 nos Students on Environment and Sanitation Programme Agriculture Training and Exposure visits provide to 600 nos of farmers Provided training to 144 nos PRI members on NREGA Training provided on AIDS to 320 nos of youth Training provided to 2334 nos SHGs Leaders on various Income Generation Programme.VARR has been honored as the Best Non Govt Organisation for its contribution to the global success of the International Year of Volunteers from United Nations UNO in 2001 Received the Best Self Help Promotion Institute of the District The Pragati Farmers Club facilitated by VARR received the Best Performing Farmer Club in the state of Orissa from Dr P Chidambaram Honourable Finance Minister of India on behalf of NABARD for the year 2004 05 The Regional Office NABARD Awarded Sabuja Farmers Club of VARR as the best Farmers Club of the state of Orissa for the year 2007 08

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: VOLUNTARY INTEGRATION FOR EDUCATION AND WELFARE OF SOCIETYâ€ ( VIEWS) is a humanitarian Development organisation, was initiated 2002 by a group of Development Professionals & students drawn from various social development field working to create last change in the lives of poor & building transformed communities. It is governed and advised by a board of eminent academicians, practitioners and social workers from national & international organizations. VIEWS have been registered as a Society under the Societies Registration Act XXI of 1860, Orissa on 4th April, 2008 (Registration number GJM No: 7781-8/2008-2009). VIEWS has been promoted with the objective of bringing highly motivated and educated young mass to the social development sector. They would work on bringing out new innovations in rural & coastal development and for up scaling development interventions to eradicate poverty in vast areas of the country serve all people irrespective of caste, religion, race, ethnicity and gender. VIEWS Group works towards bringing significant changes in the education & livelihoods of the poor through innovation & creative programs

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: VARRAT has made substantial achievements in the field of the followings by reaching to rural, tribal area communities for the comprehensive development in Kendrapara and Keonjhar District of Odisha. Considering the vital role of CBOs in the rural and tribal development process, VARRAT has strengthened 2 SHG Federations, 669 SHGs, 25 Youth Clubs, 25 Child Clubs and 40 (JJS)Jana Jagruti Sanghathan ( Apex body of the village organisation. 380 Govt. ASHA Workers under NRHM trained. 480 PRI membersâ€™ trained190 young, adolescent girls sensitized on their social economic issues. 260 rural and tribal youth leadership developed. 15 severe children provided referral services. 30 critical pregnant mothers life saved. 378 malnourished children &1986 children with childhood illness treated. 300 children in 15 Balwadi centers, 780 families linked to Govt. health services. 300 malnourished treated. More than 80% children and 85% pregnant mothers were fully immunized. 2186 children were facilitated for their higher educaation. 30 youth in driving, 25 in mason, 20 in computer skill, 30 in tailoring, 20 in motor cycle training, 10 in hope appliance repairing and engaged. 1500 women and poor farmers took vegetable cultivation. 30 women trained on micro enterprises. With the assistance of Odisha State Social Welfare Board, Govt. of Odisha, VARRAT has been managing a CRECHE centre at Lunimathia village in Mahakalpara Block of Kendrapara district. During 2015-16, total 25 tribal (3-5) year children were enrolled. With a view to improve the health condition of the target people as well as ensuring better health services & sanitation within their reach a meaningful initiative has been undertaken to promote and manage the Primary Health Centre (New) at Batighara in Mahakalpara block of Kendrapara district with the support of Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Govt. of Odisha under Public Private Partnership.. During the reporting period 34573 OPD cases attended under Allopathic and AYUSH department. Pathology services are provided to 6451 patients. In order to decrease the infant mortality and maternal mortality rate, institutional delivery has been one of the top priorities of the Government in the health sector. Due to the effort of the team, 173 deliveries were made safely in Batighar PHC (N). Convergence with Government line depts. we reach the poverty alleviation, social and economic security facilities, benefits, scheme of VARRATs, BWCs, ANMs, PHC, and CHC including other government health officials & NRHM health facilities & services are being reached to unreached tribal and marginal
